elements.title: Berit Lindholm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that dramatic soprano Berit Lindholm (pictured) was said to have been called "that damn primary school teacher" by the director of the Royal Swedish Opera, and used it in the title of her memoir?

elements.title: William D. Hoard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Los Angeles Times called William D. Hoard the "father of modern dairying"?

elements.title: Ashiq Peri (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ashiq Peri was the first prominent female folk poet in Azerbaijan?

elements.title: TV stations in Roanoke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the span of three days, a Florida man was approved by bankruptcy courts to buy TV stations in Roanoke and Lynchburg, Virginia, and then arrested on charges of laundering millions in drug money?

elements.title: Daniela Solera (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that goalkeeper Daniela Solera had the most touches of any Costa Rican player in their opening match of the 2023 World Cup?

elements.title: selection algorithms (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the study of selection algorithms has been traced to an 1883 work of Lewis Carroll on how to award second place in single-elimination tournaments?

elements.title: Lucinda Florio (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that former New Jersey first lady Lucinda Florio restored the Italianate gardens at Drumthwacket?

elements.title: Dreamland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that tens of thousands of New Yorkers traveled to see Dreamland burn?
